headline: Is PepsiCo’s (PEP) Dividend Hike a Signal of Lasting Cash Flow Strength?
summary: PepsiCo’s board recently announced a 5% increase in its quarterly dividend, raising the annualized payout to US$5.69 per share, effective with the June 2025 distribution and payable to shareholders on January 6, 2026. This move signals management’s ongoing commitment to returning capital to investors and may reflect confidence in PepsiCo’s ability to generate strong cash flow even amid broader market uncertainties. We’ll explore how this dividend increase could reinforce PepsiCo’s investment...
